page.title: 14SANDWICK _HOSWICK WHALE CASE
page.content: The housing on the hillside overlooking Hoswick Bay witnessed in 1888 a scene which we today would look upon with distaste when on 14th September a school of 340 'caa'in' whales were driven ashore. The crofter_fishermen feeling more secure by the Crofters Acts of 1886 and no longer fearing eviction disputed the claim by the landlord for his customary third of the value. At the Court of Session in Edinburgh the case ended in victory for the fishermen who were supported in their legal battle by contributions from Shetland exiles all over the world.
